item.title: Jacob Blake, is another example of the continuous Proof that...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

Jacob Blake, is another example of the continuous Proof that this system as it is has never had our best interests as Black people as Brown people as ￼ Indigenous People, in mind, and has been designed to allow officers to feel so comfortable murdering us, hurting us, and dehumanizing us, ￼in front of our family￼￼, loved ones and community. #JusticeForJacobBlake

Jacob Blake, 29, was hospitalized in serious condition after police shot him several times in Kenosha, Wisconsin. Graphic video of the incident was shared widely online.

cbsnews.com

Police in Wisconsin shoot Black man in back multiple times, sparking protests

Jacob Blake, 29, was hospitalized in serious condition after police shot him several times in Kenosha, Wisconsin. Graphic video of the incident was shared widely online.Jacob Blake, 29, was hospitalized in serious condition after police shot him several times in Kenosha, Wisconsin. Graphic video of the incident was shared widely online.
item.author: Denver Justice Project

item.title: It's not too late to contact your Denver City Council...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

It's not too late to contact your Denver City Council representative and tell them you want them to let Denverites vote on defunding the police and replacing them with a Peace Force this November! We need fundamental change, and City Council should put that kind of change on the ballot for voters to decide!
Write your council representative to tell them to support Councilwoman CdeBaca's Initiative 20-0824 using the template here: https://l.linklyhq.com/l/5uGD

HAPPENING LIVE: Young people from across Denver are hosting their own town hall about how they want to see public safety change. Tune in to the livestream now to hear how youth want to reimagine policing and public safety!

Seasoned With Grace UnBoxed was live.

item.title: Co Founder of Denver Justice Project Alexander Landau speaks of...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

Co Founder of Denver Justice Project Alexander Landau speaks of social justice isssues with a strong group of ￼panelists.

This premiere video has ended.

July 15 at 11:00 AM

USNow! July 2020 - George Floyd: Systemic Racism, Public Safety and Police BrutalityThis video is now available to watchWatch NowDenver Urban Spectrum premiered a video.

US Now! July 2020 broadcast will look at the aftermath of the life and death of George Floyd: Systemic Racism, Public Safety and Police Brutality. See what Rose...mary Lytle Lytle, Leslie Herod, Quincy Shannon Shannon, Beth McCann McCann, Juston Cooper Cooper, Susan Greene Greene, Dr. Tracie Keesee, Alexander Landau and Murphy Robinson III Robinson III have to say. Don’t miss the beginning Urban Spirit segment and watch the journey of Princess Asie Ocansey@ Asie Ocansey as One Woman. After Urban Stance, check out Urban Splendor with Denver’s own multi-talented musician and producer Bobby Wells. Cecile Perrin

item.title:
Did you know Denver is currently in collective bargaining negotiations with its Police Protective Association?
Bargaining began June 30th and lasts a maximum of 45 days. Negotiations are closed. Any agreement reached must be ratified by @DenCityCouncil. pic.twitter.com/qxZ6MNoEe3
item.content:encoded: Did you know Denver is currently in collective bargaining negotiations with its Police Protective Association? Bargaining began June 30th and lasts a maximum of 45 days. item.title: We encourage Denver folks to attend this forum hosted by the...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

We encourage Denver folks to attend this forum hosted by the Denver Citizen Oversight Board, several faith leaders, and other community groups to have your voice heard in the beginning of a series of conversations about our collective vision for reimagining how we maintain public health & safety. (Hint: we think it should include abolishing the police.)
We share many others' skepticism about task forces like these, but we know and respect many of the conveners of this forum..., we believe in community engagement even when skepticism is warranted, and as the saying goes, "if you're not at the table, you're probably on the menu." So we hope to see many people attending with a critical eye and an open mind. More info and the link to join available in this FB event: https://www.facebook.com/events/192402595525595/
Oh, and we fixed the digital flier, btw ;)

See More
item.author: Denver Justice Project

item.title: What Aurora PD did at the #ElijahMcClain violin vigil was...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

What Aurora PD did at the #ElijahMcClain violin vigil was shameful and messed up. Gassing a peaceful vigil? Taking photos mocking the young man that their coworkers brutally killed? This is how we know police don't keep people safe.

#JusticeForElijahMcClain
https://www.npr.org/…/colorado-police-officers-under-invest…

The photos surfaced after an officer with the Aurora Police Department reported them to the internal affairs unit. Officers in the photos have since been placed on administrative leave with pay.

npr.org

Colorado Police Officers Under Investigation For Photos At Elijah McClain Memorial

The photos surfaced after an officer with the Aurora Police Department reported them to the internal affairs unit. Officers in the photos have since been placed on administrative leave with pay.The photos surfaced after an officer with the Aurora Police Department reported them to the internal affairs unit. Officers in the photos have since been placed on administrative leave with pay.

item.title: #Juneteenth reminder: slavery & involuntary servitude were never abolished in the US. They are still regular practices in the US prison system, which considers all inmates - people who are black, brown, indigenous, & yes, white - as property of the state. #AbolitionIsNotAMetaphor pic.twitter.com/kd1QbwDoCN

item.content:encoded: ‼️BREAKING‼️: @GovofCO has signed #SB217 into law. Colorado becomes one of the first states in the country to END qualified immunity as part of this historic comprehensive police accountability bill. pic.twitter.com/ZHCKRpSaGL
item.author: Denver Justice Project

item.title: Tomorrow morning, as a powerful marker of Juneteenth, Governor...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

Tomorrow morning, as a powerful marker of Juneteenth, Governor Polis will sign SB217 into law. This bill ensures some of the strongest police accountability measures in the nation, including an end to qualified immunity. We are grateful to the bill sponsors: Representatives Leslie Herod and Serena Gonzales-Gutierrez and Senators Leroy Garcia and Rhonda Fields,for their leadership and ability to build a bipartisan coalition to pass this bill.

Join us tomorrow (Friday, June 1...9th) at 9 AM either on Facebook Live on Representative Herod's page (@LeslieforColorado) or in person on the West Steps of the Capitol for the bill signing and press conference!

This bill was a response to the protests and long-standing calls for action from the community, and we see its passage as an important step. Until we get to abolition, there must be greater accountability for police #AccountabilityPendingAbolition

We call on our community to continue the momentum that folks have been working to build for generations to create safe and thriving communities without police and without prisons.

See More

item.title: This is part of the reason it is important to have body cameras,...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

This is part of the reason it is important to have body cameras, along with a brave and encouraged community who is willing to record officers engaging and violent behavior￼. This video may not have surfaced otherwise which would have allowed the officers to write whatever narrative about our fallen community member￼ Derrick Scott they want...

An officer replied, “I don’t care,” and the man, Derrick Scott, died shortly afterward. This week, the Oklahoma City police released recordings of the May 2019 arrest.

nytimes.com

Video Shows Black Man Pleading ‘I Can’t Breathe’ During 2019 Arrest in Oklahoma

An officer replied, “I don’t care,” and the man, Derrick Scott, died shortly afterward. This week, the Oklahoma City police released recordings of the May 2019 arrest.An officer replied, “I don’t care,” and the man, Derrick Scott, died shortly afterward. This week, the Oklahoma City police released recordings of the May 2019 arrest.

item.title: For many years Denver justice project has talked about...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

For many years Denver justice project has talked about strengthening Peace officer standards and training. (POST) Along with ￼holding dangerous officers accountable for their actions.

Today was monumental for the state of Colorado. As SB20-217 Passed 7 - 4

Big thank you to State Representative Leslie Herod and supporter for their work on this bill.

Alexander Landau is with Terrance Roberts and 13 others.

SB20-217 passed 7 to 4

A big shout out to State Representative Leslie Herod￼￼ and all sponsors of this important step towards law-enforcement accountability in... our communities.

Also a huge shout out to every single testimonial in support of this bill. Reliving these types of trauma is never easy but as long as we use our narratives to stand for justice￼￼￼￼￼￼ its worth fighting for.

See More

item.title:
Abolition of policing without an abolition of the whole of the carceral state (jails, detention, prisons, other institutions) won't produce an abolitionist society.
Fight policing, but don't lose sight that policing does not operate independently of the criminal justice system
item.content:encoded: Abolition of policing without an abolition of the whole of the carceral state (jails, detention, prisons, other institutions) won't produce an abolitionist society. Fight policing, but don't lose sight that policing does not operate independently of the criminal justice system
item.author: Denver Justice Project

item.title: Denver Justice Project has been integral in launching an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

Denver Justice Project has been integral in launching an alternative to police project called Support Team Assisted Response, or STAR. Abolishing the police is not a metaphor and this one way to do it! STAR sends a more appropriate responses to 911 calls that have to do with substance abuse, mental health crises or people who need help connecting to services.

Read about the pilot and spread the word!

The timing was a coincidence, but the stakes have never been higher.

denverite.com

A long-planned program to remove police from some 911 calls launched as Denver’s streets erupted in police brutality protests

The timing was a coincidence, but the stakes have never been higher.The timing was a coincidence, but the stakes have never been higher.
item.author: Denver Justice Project

item.title: We are proud to announce that DJP has helped to launch the pilot...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Justice Project

We are proud to announce that DJP has helped to launch the pilot of a new alternative to police responses to medical and mental health emergencies in Denver called Support Team Assisted Response, or STAR.
While we've been quiet lately, it doesn't mean we haven't kept working to transform the foundations of law enforcement and public safety in Denver. We see this new community-driven service as a form of preventative medicine for police violence. If it had been in place long ...ago, could have prevented the deaths of Elijah McClain, Michael Marshall, Paul Castaway, Paul Childs, and countless other victims of police violence in Denver.
Abolition is not a metaphor - it's a tangible possibility, and this is an important example of how our communities can start to build the alternatives to modern policing that we need to keep our communities safe. We can have a world without police. We can have a world without prisons. And we are already on our way to building it.
Read more about the STAR program in our joint press release with Denver Homeless Out Loud, Denver Alliance for Street Health Response, Harm Reduction Action Center, and Mental Health Center of Denverhere: www.denverjusticeproject.org/…/press-release-alternative-pu…

See More
